seg-source.mrk: USING clause

target.mrk: USING clause

seg-source.mrk: USING clause

target.mrk: USING clause

trans-unit.source: The USING clause specifies which columns to test for equality when two tables are joined. It can be used instead of an ON clause in the <xref href="rrefsqlj29840.dita#rrefsqlj29840">JOIN operations</xref> that have an explicit join clause.

seg-source.mrk: The USING clause specifies which columns to test for equality when two tables are joined.
It can be used instead of an ON clause in the <xref href="rrefsqlj29840.dita#rrefsqlj29840">JOIN operations</xref> that have an explicit join clause.

target.mrk: The USING clause specifies which columns to test for equality when two tables are joined.
It can be used instead of an ON clause in the <xref href="rrefsqlj29840.dita#rrefsqlj29840">JOIN operations</xref> that have an explicit join clause.

seg-source.mrk: Syntax

target.mrk: Syntax

seg-source.mrk: USING ( simpleColumnName [ , simpleColumnName ]* )

target.mrk: USING ( simpleColumnName [ , simpleColumnName ]* )

trans-unit.source: The columns listed in the USING clause must be present in both of the two tables being joined. The USING clause will be transformed to an ON clause that checks for equality between the named columns in the two tables.

seg-source.mrk: The columns listed in the USING clause must be present in both of the two tables being joined.
The USING clause will be transformed to an ON clause that checks for equality between the named columns in the two tables.

target.mrk: The columns listed in the USING clause must be present in both of the two tables being joined.
The USING clause will be transformed to an ON clause that checks for equality between the named columns in the two tables.

trans-unit.source: When a USING clause is specified, an asterisk (*) in the select list of the query will be expanded to the following list of columns (in this order):

seg-source.mrk: When a USING clause is specified, an asterisk (*) in the select list of the query will be expanded to the following list of columns (in this order):

target.mrk: When a USING clause is specified, an asterisk (*) in the select list of the query will be expanded to the following list of columns (in this order):

trans-unit.source: All the columns in the USING clause

seg-source.mrk: All the columns in the USING clause

target.mrk: All the columns in the USING clause

trans-unit.source: All the columns of the first (left) table that are not specified in the USING clause

seg-source.mrk: All the columns of the first (left) table that are not specified in the USING clause

target.mrk: All the columns of the first (left) table that are not specified in the USING clause

trans-unit.source: All the columns of the second (right) table that are not specified in the USING clause

seg-source.mrk: All the columns of the second (right) table that are not specified in the USING clause

target.mrk: All the columns of the second (right) table that are not specified in the USING clause

trans-unit.source: An asterisk qualified by a table name (for example, COUNTRIES.*) will be expanded to every column of that table that is not listed in the USING clause.

seg-source.mrk: An asterisk qualified by a table name (for example, COUNTRIES.*) will be expanded to every column of that table that is not listed in the USING clause.

target.mrk: An asterisk qualified by a table name (for example, COUNTRIES.*) will be expanded to every column of that table that is not listed in the USING clause.

trans-unit.source: If a column in the USING clause is referenced without being qualified by a table name, the column reference points to the column in the first (left) table if the join is an INNER JOIN or a LEFT OUTER JOIN. If it is a RIGHT OUTER JOIN, unqualified references to a column in the USING clause point to the column in the second (right) table.

seg-source.mrk: If a column in the USING clause is referenced without being qualified by a table name, the column reference points to the column in the first (left) table if the join is an INNER JOIN or a LEFT OUTER JOIN.
If it is a RIGHT OUTER JOIN, unqualified references to a column in the USING clause point to the column in the second (right) table.

target.mrk: If a column in the USING clause is referenced without being qualified by a table name, the column reference points to the column in the first (left) table if the join is an INNER JOIN or a LEFT OUTER JOIN.
If it is a RIGHT OUTER JOIN, unqualified references to a column in the USING clause point to the column in the second (right) table.

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: The following query performs an inner join between the COUNTRIES table and the CITIES table on the condition that COUNTRIES.COUNTRY is equal to CITIES.COUNTRY:

seg-source.mrk: The following query performs an inner join between the COUNTRIES table and the CITIES table on the condition that COUNTRIES.COUNTRY is equal to CITIES.COUNTRY:

target.mrk: The following query performs an inner join between the COUNTRIES table and the CITIES table on the condition that COUNTRIES.COUNTRY is equal to CITIES.COUNTRY:

seg-source.mrk: SELECT * FROM COUNTRIES JOIN CITIES USING (COUNTRY)

target.mrk: SELECT * FROM COUNTRIES JOIN CITIES USING (COUNTRY)

trans-unit.source: The next query is similar to the one above, but it has the additional join condition that COUNTRIES.COUNTRY_ISO_CODE is equal to CITIES.COUNTRY_ISO_CODE:

seg-source.mrk: The next query is similar to the one above, but it has the additional join condition that COUNTRIES.COUNTRY_ISO_CODE is equal to CITIES.COUNTRY_ISO_CODE:

target.mrk: The next query is similar to the one above, but it has the additional join condition that COUNTRIES.COUNTRY_ISO_CODE is equal to CITIES.COUNTRY_ISO_CODE:

trans-unit.source: SELECT * FROM COUNTRIES JOIN CITIES USING (COUNTRY, COUNTRY_ISO_CODE)

seg-source.mrk: SELECT * FROM COUNTRIES JOIN CITIES USING (COUNTRY, COUNTRY_ISO_CODE)

target.mrk: SELECT * FROM COUNTRIES JOIN CITIES USING (COUNTRY, COUNTRY_ISO_CODE)
